Chad votes yes to new constitution backed by juntaChadians have voted in favour of a new constitution that critics say could help cement the power of junta leader Mahamat Idriss Deby. Russia says it downs four Ukrainian military aircraftRussia's defence ministry said on Sunday its air defence systems had shot down four Ukrainian military aircraft over the past 24 hours, just two days after Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said Kyiv had downed three Russian fighter-bomber jets. UK to send naval ship to Guyana amid Venezuela border disputeBritain will deploy a naval ship off Guyana later this month, its ministry of defence said on Sunday, as the South American nation faces a border dispute with neighbour Venezuela over the oil-rich Essequibo region. Gaza workers wrap bodies in shrouds in bombed-out northern GazaOn a patch of sandy ground between collapsed masonry, burnt out buildings and damaged cars, civil defence workers move from body to body, wrapping white shrouds around a group of people killed in Gaza's 11-week-old war. Beijing breaks a seven-decade cold-weather recordSome areas in the northeast hit -40 degrees Celsius and Fahrenheit as biting cold air flowed from the Arctic. A Beijing observatory recorded more than 300 hours of below-freezing temperatures since Dec. 11.
